There is only one way that we, the living, can properly thank them for their sacrifice as Americans.

"And that is to fight to live free.

"God bless them, and God bless a free American people." 

Full remarks: https://t.co/fhnboWD4ie

1399552725856231425.text: "The truth is that we cannot hallow them today any more than they have already done by their own actions.

1399552724685967363.text:
We make it clear that we will live free.

"We gather today not to mourn. In the words of General Patton, 'It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather we should thank God such men lived.'

1399552723402596353.text:
"More than that, they died for a promise made by America’s founding to the whole world and to a slew of tyrants yet to come, that not only is this what we believe: it is what we will do.

"We answer the siren call of tyranny over the mind of man with a cannon.

1399552722039447554.text: "They died for the self-evident truths that all men are created equal and are therefore endowed by our Creator with inalienable rights.

1399552720844034053.text: "They died for something far greater than themselves. Their sacrifice, from generation to generation, is bound by the golden thread of American liberty.

1399552719522865163.text:
"Whether they carried a smoothbore musket or an M16,

"Whether the flag they fought under had 13 stars or 50,

1399552717983465486.text: "Whether they were spurred to service by the pamphlets of Thomas Paine, the patriotic call at the point of Uncle Sam or the heart-rending collapse of the World Trade Center we all witnessed,

1399552716960059398.text: "Whether they fell on the slope of bunker hill, the beaches of Normandy or the mountains of Afghanistan,

1399552715638853633.text:
"This, to put it plainly, is why we are here.

"What does it say about the character of a man who would lay down his life for not just another man, as the scripture says, but for generations of future Americans?

1399552714200293376.text: "And to those who selfishly celebrate a long weekend for its sake, they should remember the words of President FDR. 'Those who have long enjoyed such privileges as we enjoy forget in time that men have died to win them.'

1399552713038385155.text:
These are the people we remember today.

"Today is not a day devoted to our many heroes who walk among us — police officers, firefighters, countless others who put their lives on the line for us every day, or even, respectfully, veterans.

1399552711754981376.text:
In our history:

-1.3 million war deaths
-1.5 million wounded
-Over 41 million served in combat theaters over our almost 250 years the majority of whom have passed to the heavens.
-Almost 4 million are buried in national cemeteries, over 400,000 in Arlington

1399552710492540929.text: "GK Chesterton described courage like this: 'Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.'

1399552709238444032.text:
"All toward a continent thousands of miles away on the other side of an ocean from his family and home?

"The answer is the cause of freedom and the courage to fight for it.

1399552707799785474.text: "What calls a man to stand up, jump out of a Higgins boat into a hail of bullets and mortar fire, then run though the freezing water toward a tall cliff to climb as he watches his brothers fall alongside him?

1399406129940250630.text:

The father of our country, George Washington, famously called the Constitution — which his wisdom helped craft and guide to fruition — “the guide which I never will abandon.” 

We owe it the same fidelity in this case and all others.

1345873707131154436.text: If the electors for the office of the president were not in question, neither would be the election certificates of my colleagues present here today.

1345873706392952834.text: While the Constitution and the 12th Amendment do not make Congress the judge of the states’ presidential electors, it does require us to be the arbiters of the elections to this body.

1345873501564116994.text: I believe our body should vote on the certification of those members to ensure the integrity of the House of Representatives is guarded from all suspicion of illegitimacy.

1345873272831963141.text:
Today, I objected to the seating of my colleagues from six states: AZ, GA, MI, NV, PA, and WI.

It would confound reason if the presidential results of these states were to face objection while the congressional results of the same process escaped public scrutiny. https://t.co/VzmafDSsT7

1345819582901215233.text: "Absent such action, there is not a constitutional role for Congress to change the outcome of any state’s vote."

1345819582104272897.text: "If states believe there was fraud—and if they believe that such fraud affected the outcome of the election—they must, as a body, convene immediately and send us that information, along with certified electoral votes cast by a Trump slate of electors."

1345819335424679937.text: "[O]nly the states have authority to appoint electors, in accordance with state law. Congress has only a narrow role in the presidential election process. Its job is to count the electors submitted by the states, not to determine which electors the states should have sent."

1268350843541225478.text: Last week, the Paycheck Protection Flexibility Act passed the House overwhelmingly 417-1. I was thrilled to see the bill pass the Senate this evening.  I’d like to thank my colleagues in the House and Senate for working together to take swift, decisive action.

1268350841775366150.text: ...to get it done. Our hard work started gaining traction immediately. It won the support of a diverse coalition of in excess of 50 outside groups, as well as bipartisan support.

1268350837807624193.text:

1268350830920568832.text: From my conversations, as well as numerous visits with business owners, employees, and members of our #TX21 community, it became clear that changes were necessary to make the program work for many businesses.
